article: A snake handler who cheated death after being badly bitten by a snake is now teaching Australians how to  _  .Neville-Burns has been bitten twelve times during his long work with snakes, and uses all his  _  to give lectures to people at risk of meeting a snake  _  . Australia is home to most of the world's most deadly snakes.So Neville  _  the people how to deal with such close unexpected meetings..He sets up an enclosed area, and one by one, brings out four snakes so people can know the  _  of each snake.First out of the bag is a Red Black Snake.He  _  put his finger on it.That's  _  the entire forefinger on his right hand was  cut off  after he was bitten.But that wasn't his  _  experience.-When he was 18? a Brown Snake he had been holding by the tail  _  and bit him in the face.He was rushed to  _  and he was saved from death. He says a Cobra Snake is perhaps very  _  but not the most venomous . A black Manba Snake, one of the most  _  , is the longest venomous snake in the world.A Brown Snake is the final  _  at Neville's show.It is one of the most common snakes in Australia, and is the second most venomous in the world.Several times during the  _  it bits the bag; which Neville  _  . Neville's advice is to stay  _  if a snake is nearby, as most will only  _  if they feel threatened.He tells people to be  _  but not to pick one 'up by the tail.He then does exactly that as part of his show.He also says he  _  believes in the old saying "once bitten, twice shy".
